bill_title: require that certain persons convicted of drug and alcohol felonies be incarcerated in the county jail.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain persons convicted of drug and alcohol felonies be incarcerated in the county jail. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, whenever the state's attorney of any county prosecutes any person of a crime involving the possession or distribution of any controlled substance or of a crime of driving while under the influence, unless the crime of which the person is charged is a Class 4 felony or higher, the person so convicted shall be incarcerated in the county jail of the county in which the crime was committed. If the county is unable or unwilling to incarcerate such person in the county jail, the county shall reimburse such other jail or penal institution where the person is incarcerated and serves the sentence for all expenses of incarceration, including all expenses collateral to incarceration. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
